selected_quotes: Our new paper: Splatter: simulation of single-cell RNA-seq.
Simulation of single-cell #RNAseq data with Splatter
High-time that something like this exists. Too little testing has been norm for too long and this should help.
Top #tweeted story in #bioscience: Splatter: simulation of single-cell RNA sequ… see more
This looks like a useful tool! Splatter: simulation of single-cell RNA sequencing data

citation.abstract: As single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) technologies have rapidly developed, so have analysis methods. Many methods have been tested, developed, and validated using simulated datasets. Unfortunately, current simulations are often poorly documented, their similarity to real data is not demonstrated, or reproducible code is not available. Here, we present the Splatter Bioconductor package for simple, reproducible, and well-documented simulation of scRNA-seq data. Splatter provides an interface to multiple simulation methods including Splat, our own simulation, based on a gamma-Poisson distribution. Splat can simulate single populations of cells, populations with multiple cell types, or differentiation paths.
citation.title: Splatter: simulation of single-cell RNA sequencing data
